data.title: Supper at Carnevor
data.text: We had supper at Carnevor on Sunday evening, 11/12/2016. We ordered the Petite Fillet with the wine sauce and it was excellent. The meat was tender and done exactly to our request. We had an excellent server who pleasantly informed us of the specials for the evening and was very prompt with our order and checked back with us to see how the meal was progressing. We loved the special treatment and will definitely return for another meal.

data.title: For steak this is it in MKE
data.text:
Being from Chicago we know a good quality Steakhouse. 
The staff was excellent. Both knowledgeable and fun and timely with courses. Wine selection was great as well. Salads were fresh and tasty as were the brussel sprouts. We both had the Filet's which were cooked to perfection at medium rare. I had the Au poivre sauce which was very good.
When in Milwaukee we will definitely be back.

data.title: Excellent Anniversary Choice
data.text: We chose Carnevor as our 35th wedding anniversary choice this year and we were completely happy with our choice.  I read a couple of the recent reviews and could hardly believe that we were in the same place.  We did dine there on a Wednesday evening and it was rather quiet, but a decent amount of patrons.  Service at the bar was very attentive; bar staff was social and drinks were made well.  We were able to go to our table much earlier than our reservation, which worked out well because we live an hour away.  Our waiter brought menus and explained them well and made some recommendations that helped us make some great choices.  I had an 8oz filet with 1/2# crab legs and husband had the 20oz ribeye.  Both were cooked well and tasted amazing.  We had the BLT salad chopped and split and also shared the asparagus.  For dessert we received a complimentary Beignet plate with blueberries, cream and chocolate sauce (yum). Service Was outstanding and valet parking was very convenient.

data.title: Not a Special Venue........
data.text:
Pros - Waiter acknowledged our 18th Wedding Anniversary and it was written into our menu. Owner paid our dinner. Why? See Cons.. 

Cons - Res at 7:15 arrived 7:10, very noisy & crowded (violating fire code?). Nearly cancelled "Romantic" dinner right then. Escorted to bar next door & not their own bar(glad not January). Seated at 7:45 (outside to return). Order two glass wine two app two Filet & two side. Wine took 15 min to get apps 10 min later (start math). Drank my wine, wife sipped hers. Water filled twice. Waiter picked up plates for apps (remember no wine). 15 min waiter returns with knife & fork for steaks (wine still empty), as he walked away he glances & finally noticed. Got more, took glass & you guessed it, another 15 min. We hear waiters apologizing to others for a 30 group dominating the kitchen. We had been sitting in a room about 45 min & no entrees hit any table. Room held 6 tops, 4 tops & a few of doubles with my wife & I in the corner & two more in center. Waiter came & told us our food was being plated & finally apologized for the delay. Meanwhile a 6 top finished & employees broke down the table & pushed a 2 top right against another couple in the middle of their meal. Finally got our food at about 9:20. Ate but no dessert. Waiter knew we were upset & waived the drinks. Manager apologized & knew this was not the Special Occasion we had planned. Finally the owner came over & my wife detailed our worst dinner experience ever. Told owner a reserved large group should not cripple your kitchen. If you want a high priced Logan's Steakhouse this is your place. 2+ hrs. in a loud, crowded, bar cheering the baseball game is not "Special". Owner should try Prime or Fleur in Vegas, Burns in Tampa, or Bohanan's in San Antonio to experience fine dining. As I left I informed Mgr there should not be a charge to my card. He called the next day to confirm it was not charged. This simply is not fine dining.

data.title: Such fantastic food and such bad service
data.text:
Went to dinner with my wife and brother and the only reservations I could get on a Saturday was for 5:00pm. We got there 10 minutes early and the wait staff said they were not open without giving us the option to wait at the bar. I had to ask can we wait at the bar and the response was I suppose so which prompted me to ask if the bar and restaurant were separate businesses? The waiter was kind but rarely checked back with us and the busboys walked past us time and again without removing our finished plates. The food was heavenly but I didn't want to keep looking at out empty plates. I ordered dessert to go and it was delivered to the table without a bag.
I will go back for the food knowing the service will be subpar.

data.title: If you are carnivorous, you'll like "Carnevor" !
data.text:
For the purpose of full disclosure:  I received no payment or anything of value in return for this review or any reviews I have written in the past. I fully pay my own freight when it comes to dining.

My wife and I had tickets to see "Man of La Mancha" at the Milwaukee Repertory Theatre complex on Oct. 23, 2016.  Decided to go to dinner before the show and many of downtown Milwaukee's finest restaurants are closed on Sundays.  We elected to go to a SURG group restaurant, "Carnevor", located between Wisconsin Avenue and Mason Street.  The restaurant is in a block with a number of other SURG properties and can be a bit tricky to find.  It on on the east side of the street, next to "Distil".  

The restaurant is a long, narrow building that is richly appointed in very dark wood.  There was what looked like long wooden sticks/stakes providing a wall from the glass hall into the building.  Walls were in dark wood with small lights in the high ceilings and wall sconces.  Tables were dark wood and seats were cushioned and dark.  The only problem with the environment is the chair legs did not slide across the carpeting in the dining room we were seated in.  The restaurant looked like it could easily hold 100 patrons or more, in addition to a bar area located behind the host station.  Can't say I've been in as clean a rest room as the men's room was in any restaurant.  

Our server was Shane (?) and my wife ordered a petite filet that came with some mini-double baked potatoes and steamed vegetables.  I ordered a special, an 8 ounce filet with 3 scallops.  I also ordered a "BLT wedge, which was to be a wedge of Iceberg lettuce, with blue cheese dressing, bacon, and a tomato.  I only wanted the lettuce, bacon, and ranch dressing.  Note to the salad lover:  Rather than being given a full wedge of lettuce, the wedge was cut up and served on a rectangular platter. The bacon was Nueske's and perfectly crisp.  The ranch dressing seemed to be homemade and quite good.  With my meal, I ordered Saffron Risotto, which had bits of cabbage and radish in it.  The risotto was described as a dish that was plentiful enough it could be shared by two people.  WRONG !!  I tend to eat like I AM two people, and it wasn't enough for me.  However, I cannot even describe to you how good the risotto was - even though it was a wee bit soupy for my taste.  My steak was ordered medium and the center was absolutely red.  I'd estimate the steak was medium rare.  Ordinarily, I'd have sent it back, but the beef was so perfectly aged that the serving of it medium rare was just fine.  The scallops were also a bit undercooked.  Rather than a perfectly white center, they were a bit pearlescent.  But, both scallops and steaks were very good.  Service was excellent without being intrusive.  

Cost of our dinner, with one Stella Artois and 2 vodka gimlets came to a total of $160, which is a bit pricey.  My experience has been that one always gets what they pay for when dining at a SURG restaurant.  

PROS:  intimate dining setting; unique decor; clean restrooms; prompt service; good food.

CONS:  parking around the restaurant can be a bit dicey; music over the speakers in the restaurant was "classic rock" mix type of music.  Somehow, I don't find Jimi Hendrix's "If 6 was 9", off the "Axis: Bold as Love" (December 1967, on Reprise Records) as the type of music I'd like to hear while dining in a rather fancy place.  Not that I'm a prude either (I saw Jimi play live in Madison in 1968), but the play list was a bit odd; and food costs are pricey.

Nonetheless, my wife and I keep coming back.  Very hard to get an average or bad meal at SURG !!

data.title: Dinner with friends
data.text: Service and food were phenomenal...Steak was extremely tender, lobster bisque was to die for....would highly recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Great Steaks
data.text:
Probably the best steak house in town - and a nicely designed updated one at that. Not the old school wood paneled, red upholstered booth type of steak house. Refreshing design, excellent service, very high quality food. If you don't feel like a steak the salmon is delicious as well.
Highly recommend.

data.title: Great date night
data.text: Great atmosphere for celebrating! The wine list is amazing, we had a bottle of French Burgundy, it was lovely! To eat, we had the wagu beef, amazing!

data.title: Dinner
data.text:
You start out with warm bread and some deliciousness to spread on it. We had the 8oz filet which was super tender and these mini twice baked potatoes. Yum!
Love the atmosphere and service. You will not be disappointed. 👍🏻

owner_response.author: SURG_RestaurantGroup, Guest Relations Manager at Carnevor, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We're so glad you enjoyed your dinner with us! Thank you for the review!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: Probably one of the best steaks I've ever had.  Service was very good.   We arrived kind of late but we didn't feel rushed.   A must have next time I'm in Milwaukee.

owner_response.author: SURG_RestaurantGroup, Guest Relations Manager at Carnevor, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the great review, Ginette! We can't wait for your next visit with us.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Special Place  For a Special Event
data.text:
Decided to go to Carnevor for a celebration of our son's 30th birthday. I have not been here for a while or since they expanded. We were not disappointed. This place has always had a good reputation for a good steak and as I said not disappointed. We had dry aged NY Strips, Bone in Filets. All the meat was delicious. Sides were great too. 
The one disappointment was the waiter forgot our appies (crab cakes) and brought them just as our dinners were coming out too. I have had better Caesar salads too but it was good.
As a treat they had "Happy Birthday" on the menu to my son and comped a couple desserts. 
Overall a pretty good experience and I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

data.title: For the meat lover
data.text: Not for the vegetarian. Excellent variety of meats and cuts served by attentive staff in rooms decorated to make you feel like inside a beast, with large "ribs" dangling from the ceiling...

data.title: Great Celebration Restuaran for Birthday
data.text: We chose to have my wife's Birthday dinner at Carnevor's while we were in town visiting daughter and son-in-law. We all thoroughly enjoyed our meal. We each got a different cut of steak which were cooked exactly as we ordered them. We had a couple of different appetizers to share, including the crab cake, which was outstanding.  Our waiter was attentive and authentic with. His suggestions and recommendations which we all appreciated.  Each side dish ordered also did not disappoint and were plenty big to share with the table. To finish of the evening, the restaurant treated my wife and table to a fantastic dessert.  It was the perfect end to a perfect meal.

data.title: a great experience
data.text: Friends recommended this place and joined us for dinner.  The food was superb and everyone enjoyed their meal.  The wine was excellent and the service was stellar(thank you, Stan). Everything was well-paced and delicious.  The only complaint was the portions were small considering the price.  Entrees start at about $36 and go rapidly up from there.  One of the specials was $100. I don't often eat meals at that price.  If you win the Lotto, by all means take a group.  If you are trying to win a different kind of Lotto, by all means, take your date.

data.title: Amazing Service Food, Service and Ambience
data.text:
We had an amazing dining experience last week. Lets just say Michael and Josh our lead waiters did not miss a single detail. They were polite and not overbearing but always present. The food was simple fantastic...I am pretty sure in our party of 22 folks we ordered at least one of every steak on the menu, including the Japanese Wagyu "A-5" Filet- simple wow for the Wagyu. It was a special night so we topped it with the Wagyu A-5. We shared it a bit and all were blown away. Yes it is expensive at $161 but it was worth it. All the steaks were excellent.

We were able to have a private room for our party right behind the bar. This room was perfect for our dinner and there was no additional charge for the private room.

We will be back next time we are in Milwaukee

data.title: Highly Recommended - What A Surprise
data.text: I was actually going to go to the well known steakhouse in Milwaukee and the hotel staff recommended that I try Carnevor and it was literally across the street. Traveling myself, I took a seat at the bar which had a super friendly talented bar staff. I had a Spotted Cow, which was quite a treat as you can only get it in Wisconsin. The server recommended the fillet, which was absolutely outstanding. If I am ever back in town this is definitely my first choice. I have eaten at the top steakhouses all over the country and Carnevor definitely rates in their league. You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Great choice for steak.
data.text: Although the restaurant had some large parties at dinner time, the hostess suggested their full service bar.  Addie was exceptional with drink mixing, timeliness, attitude and even offered some suggestions from the menu.  The filet of beef tenderloin was cooked  to an even medium rare as ordered and more flavorful than many I have tried at other steakhouses.

data.title: Great service, great menu
data.text: If you are looking for a wide range choice of meats, this is your place. You can have a great dinner for a good price or exquisite steaks for a lot of $$$. Everything is available, the service is super attentive, nice atmosphere, good beer and wine list. Will be coming back

data.title: Very Nice Steakhouse with Five Star Service
data.text: We arrived at Carnevor with a group of 8 people and they made an effort to seat us promptly, which we greatly appreciated!. Our server (David) was very energetic and knowledgeable about the drinks and food on the menu. Everyone in our group loved their food. My favorite was the King Crab with the mashed potatoes!
